data.title: Manager & Senior Consultant | Technology Risk (IT Audit) | HCM & HN
data.content:
At KPMG Tax and Advisory Ltd., IT Audit & Technology Risk Consulting is a part of our IT Advisory. Our professionals have a solid understanding of both business and technology, enabling them to help our clients effectively respond to digital risk. Through our holistic perspective, we frequently collaborate with other consulting teams to provide value to our clients' businesses.

We are seeking young, enthusiastic experienced professionals with strong leadership skills to join our team in the Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City offices.

benefits.value: Gifts for Wedding, having babies, Women’s day and Children Day
K-Club, Koffee Club, Mylife, Starrewards program
Professional Qualifications/ Technical & Soft skill training

Having Business/Technology Degree, Certification, or equivalent.
Independent, self-motivated, open-minded, organized, results oriented and positive “can do” attitudes.
Experience in the position of (and/or):
Team leader for IT functions (Security, Network, Infrastructure, Application etc.);
Internal/External Audit;
Quality Control or Assurance (QC/QA);
Assessor for ISO27001, PCI-DSS etc.
Experience in conducting Cybersecurity assessment (Vulnerability assessment, Penetration testing, Source-code review etc.) is a plus.
Experience in conducting IT risk assessment, IT architecture design, ITSM implementation, Solution Implementation (IAM, SIEM, PAM, DLP etc.) is a plus.
Having CISA, CISM, CISSP, CEH, CEPT, GPEN, etc. or equivalents is a plus.

data.title: IT Operations lead
data.content:
franklin.ai aims to improve efficiency, affordability and quality in digital pathology using artificial intelligence solutions, and consequently impacting the lives and health outcomes of patients around the world. Leveraging world-leading AI technology, best engineering practices and a wealth of clinical expertise, franklin.ai is building the next generation of technologies that will become the standard clinical practice in pathology.

As an IT Operations lead, you will play an integral role in the development of our class-leading products by ensuring our IT infrastructure, used by our staff and pathologists within Vietnam, is highly effective, efficient, and secure. Supporting our sites and pathologists in Ho Chi Minh and

Hanoi, as well as our remote staff, you will have highly effective communication and problem-solving skills to ensure the IT needs of the business are supported. You will also be working closely with franklin.ai's IT team in Australia to standard IT operations and define our standard operating environments. As such, you will need to be highly proficient in written and spoken English.

This role is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to blend traditional on-premise infrastructure with modern, cloud-based SaaS services, whilst working in a high growth and collaborative environment with a team of motivated and highly skilled engineers and clinicians across Vietnam and Australia.

benefits.value: Social – Health – Insurance paid fully after probation period
Office with most advanced working equipment

value: Excellent communication, written and spoken English language skills.

Experience supporting Microsoft 365, Azure and identity management.
Excellent knowledge of technical management, information analysis and of computer hardware/software systems.
Hands-on experience supporting and troubleshooting physical computer networks, laptops, desktops, and peripherals both onsite and remotely.
Experience in using a service desk management system including prioritisation of tasks and managing multiple workloads
Self-motivated with the ability to set and lead your agenda and workloads with minimal supervision
Industry-recognised certifications in relevant disciplines such as Microsoft 365, Azure, System administration and/or cloud engineering
Preferred Qualifications:
Though not essential, a relevant industry qualification such as the examples below is highly desirable within this role.
Microsoft Certified: Azure Fundamentals
Microsoft Certified: 365 Fundamentals
Graduate Diploma in IT management
Note: Please send your CV in English

Có khả năng làm việc nhóm, chịu được áp lực công việc.

data.title: IT - GIÁM ĐỐC PHÁT TRIỂN ỨNG DỤNG
data.content: We are looking for software technical leaders (in both core and non-core) who are responsible for the leading team and handling the technical architecture for the projects. The candidate should have good experience in software and infrastructure architecture, security design patterns, microservices architecture, coding standards, RESTful APIs, single sign-on, single sign-off, Oauth 2.0, OpenID, LDAP, SAML, and federated identity management.

benefits.value: Average 15 Monthly Base salary per year. 13 Monthly Base Salary.

value: Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field.
At least 1 years of experience in the role of Software Architect/Technical Leader.
Expert in Java Technologies (Spring Boot, Hibernate, Spring Data, Spring Security...), .Net (Core, non-core)
Excellent in Microservices Architecture for applications.
Good knowledge of OOP, design patterns, multithreading/concurrency programming, data structure, and algorithms.
Good foundation of SQL and NoSQL databases, such as Oracle, PostgreSQL, Couchbase, MongoDB.
Experience in distributed storage & messaging systems (RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, Kafka…), microservices, ELK, and mobile development.
Experience with event-driven applications using queues, service buses, and other related patterns.
Knowledge of Keycloak/Redhat SSO is a big plus.
Experience AWS/Azure... preferred.
Experience with containerized applications using Docker, Kubernetes, or another similar tooling.
Experience defining and driving SecDevOps best practices within large teams.
Experience establishing legacy modernization and migration roadmaps for large-scale applications.
Understanding of CI/CD software development environments.
Experience in Agile development teams
Interested in dealing with technical challenges and keen on exploring new things.
Good problem-solving skills and teamwork spirit.
Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with other developers and stakeholders.
